issues.title: Clarify terminology
issues.author: PieterKas
issues.body:
This is a carry-over from @PieterKas, but this PR would be a good chance to fix this too I will mention it:
In my opinion we should not use the terminology `client_id` and `client_id`, we should use "client ID" and "client secret" (capitalized only when referred to specifically The Client ID or The Client Secret).

The terms `client_id` and `client_secret` should only be used when we are referring specifically to the parameters, which are snake_cased and usually in code formatting.

_Originally posted by @dagdagdag83 in https://github.com/PieterKas/OAuth-and-SPIFFE-Registration/issues/1#issuecomment-2915672570_

comments.author: PieterKas
comments.body: @dagdagdag83 - would you like to propose a PR for this?

comments.author: dagdagdag83
comments.body: @PieterKas yep, I can do it next week 👍

issues.title: Generalize Pattern with SPIFFE as an example
issues.author: PieterKas
issues.body: Based on conversations with @dagdagdag83 - this may be better to write as a "general framework" and then use SPIFFE as an instance of that pattern.

issues.title: Section 3 needs examples
issues.author: deansaxe
issues.body: I recommend adding some examples for section 3. Specifically, an appendix to address the registration of OAuth metadata (last sentence, 3rd paragraph) which shows specific examples of how metadata may be registered.

issues.title: Figure 1 Step A
issues.author: deansaxe
issues.body: Can this step by dynamic or must the SPIFFE issuer be pre-configured for the server?  In other words, can the SPIFFE issuer be dynamically configured as an option?

issues.title: FIgure 1 Step B
issues.author: deansaxe
issues.body: Step B indicates that the x.509-SVID and SVID-JWT are both required to be registered.  Can this be an OR or an AND/OR?  I'm unclear whether both credential types must be supported or whether the AS can choose to support one credential type or both.

issues.title: Figure 2 issues
issues.author: deansaxe
issues.body:
Step E and F between the client and AS should be relabeled F and G.

Step E seems to have the arrow pointed in the wrong direction.

issues.title: Section 4.1 SHOULD --> MUST?
issues.author: deansaxe
issues.body: Section 4.1 says the client SHOULD authenticate.  Should this SHOULD be changed to a MUST to require authN of the client with an SVID-JWT or x.509-SVID?

pulls.title: Fix typos and diagrams
pulls.author: heymarcel
pulls.body:
- Language suggestions
- Fixed minor typos
- Cleaned up diagrams, but still not sure whether logic is right in the authorization code grant diagram
